column3: The Pier is a perfect place to lounge out on a nice day. It has a big grass area with a walkway around it.  I have made this part of my running route for years now and I love it. The view is second to none and will never disappoint.  The pier goes pretty far out into the water too so you are pretty close to NYC with an unobstructed view. So nice!Years ago they had a concert here so not sure why they don't do that anymore. It was a pretty fun time too. They do have movie nights in the summer on Wednesdays I believe.  It does get crowded in the summer so come get a spot but usually you will be fine and have your space.  They also have a 9/11 memorial here for all the people from Hoboken that we lost in the tragedy. It is a really nice tribute to them. Pier A is one of those places that is unique to Hoboken and makes the city what it is! Come check it out!
TL-DR: One of Hoboken's local retreats

column14: Mumford & Sons put on an amazing show. The only negative I can think of is the fact that the bathrooms and beer and food are all on the left when you enter. So if you actually venture into the crowd
column15: and walk all the way to the right of the pier - you better hope you dont have to leave that spot for the entirety of the concert. Could be alleviated with some barricades creating a path on that right side so you can walk around the perimeter of the crowd instead of cutting through and pissing off a whole slew of people.

column3: was an amazing outdoor venue for a concert.  saw Mumford & Sons here and the show ended in fireworks!
Great views of Manhattan
column4: nice wide open grass area
column5: spitting distance to the Hudson river.  This one is hard to beat.  I also recommend the events they hold here in the summer like Movies on Wednesday Nights
column6: they just had the Party with Purpose 5K here and in August Mumford & Sons are playing!!!!  Also
column7: you are walking distance to the great restaurants and bars that Hoboken has to offer.This is one of the nicest parks I've even been too in Jersey.

column3: I came here to see the 4th of July fireworks.  I have always gone to Jersey city to get a  good view of the NYC Skyline in general
column4: but Pier A is just as good.  The grass goes on forever
column5: and there were many people laying down for a picnic. You do not get quite the same experience on Hudson place.

column3: I love this place... I really do. This is what I affectionately refer to as the Hoboken Beach
column4: since everyone loves to lay out here. Great pier to run around (which I do 5 times a week)
column5: and great place to just sit and and hang out and enjoy the breeze and view and water.My only complaint is the homeless people who have claimed this land as their own... go for an early morning (.i.e. before 6 AM) expect to be heckled by homeless people

column3: My son is a huge Cake Boss fan and we discovered this park by accident one day several years ago while walking around Hoboken.  It has become one of my favorite places on earth.  Any time we go into the city we drive to Hoboken
column4: grab breakfast and eat down by the water before we hop on the Path and we try to spend some time at the park before we head back home.  The view is amazing and it always quiet and peaceful no matter how many people are there.  It's my happy place!  :)

column3: Pier A Park is one of the best things about Boken
column4: and by far is the best way to see Manhattan and the Hudson. Expect a lot of people laying out in summer
column5: and expect to see some guys at the end fishing all year long. This is a great place to relax
column6: walk around
column7: and they have done nice improvements over the years adding the water kids area and 9-11 memorial. Pier C is a nice addition up the river a bit also.

column3: Pier A park is a great part of Hoboken. Its iconic Manhattan skyline views probably rank in the top 5 vantage points. The fountain in the warmer months is beautiful. A good chuck of the grass area was removed  about 7 years ago to plant about 50 ginko trees to remember Hoboken 9/11 victims
column4: so you can't complain about that
column5: but that area is missed.During June through August movies are shown every Wednesday night on one of those large inflatable screens. It's a great place to bring a blanket
column6: some take-out dinner
column7: and some clandestine wine
column8: to enjoy a movie under the stars.Pier A is also great for people watching. From joggers and people doing yoga to people fishing
column9: there's always something interesting to see.

column3: One of the best parts of living in Hoboken is that you can run along the river at Pier A park and enjoy an incredible view of Manhattan.  This park has plenty of seating and is a little oasis just a few blocks off Washington.  The only thing that I would say is a drawback is the fact that there's an abundance of homeless people who sleep in this park so super early morning runs aren't the best.  Anyone I've taken here
column4: though
column5: has been incredibly impressed.  It's a staple on my "This is why I moved to Hoboken" tour...

column3: It's a tiny park but I like it.  It juts out into the water so you get an awesome view of Manhattan.  There are tons of benches surrounding the park
column4: so you can sit and watch the people go by.I like it when urban parks are active and this one is.  There are tons of people with their kids
column5: jogging or walking by.  Granted
column6: today was a holiday but the other time I was nearby
column7: the park was also active.When I was there today a HUGE Holland America cruise ship was sailing down the Hudson and back out to sea.  It made me sort of jealous as I've not been on a cruise in over a year.  That's what makes this little park great.  You've got tons of activity from the people around you but also the activity on the Hudson. There is also that great view of the city.  The fact that it's a hop
column8: skip and a jump from all sorts of transport is great too. I took the lightrail from Liberty State Park (boring...skip it) to the Hoboken terminal.  Then I just walked over to the park and hung out.5-stars is reserved for the awesome of awesome parks
column9: like Yosemite.  This little patch of green is unexpected and does the trick when you just need to relax a bit.
